docs.title: Access
docs.text:
Description:

a metadata schema block containing RAiD access information

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

docs.title: Access.AccessType
docs.text:
Description:

None

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

docs.title: Access.AccessType.id
docs.text:
Description:

the type of access granted to a RAiD metadata record

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: ‘Restricted access’ and ‘Metadata only’, though part of the upstream vocabulary, are disallowed.

Allowed values (fetched at the time of the documentation generation):

Value Description https://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/access_rights/c_abf2/ https://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/access_rights/c_abf2/ https://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/access_rights/c_f1cf/ https://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/access_rights/c_f1cf/

This is a dynamic enumeration whose values are defined in externally managed vocabulary.

Link to the vocabulary:

https://vocabulary.raid.org/access.type.schemaUri/208

docs.title: Access.AccessType.schemaUri
docs.text:
Description:

the URI of the access type schema

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: The RAiD controlled list includes only a subset of the COAR vocabulary (https://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/access_rights/1.1/), including ‘Open access’ and ‘Embargoed access’, but excluding ‘Restricted access’ (since no permanently restricted RAiDs are allowed), and ‘Metadata only’ (since RAiDs by design contain only metadata).

Allowed values (fetched at the time of the documentation generation):

Value Description https://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/access_rights/ https://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/access_rights/

This is a dynamic enumeration whose values are defined in externally managed vocabulary.

Link to the vocabulary:

https://vocabulary.raid.org/access.type.schemaUri/207

docs.title: Access.AccessStatement
docs.text:
Description:

a metadata schema block containing an explanation for any access type that is not ‘open’, with the explanation’s associated properties.

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

Language

docs.title: Access.AccessStatement.Language
docs.text:
Description:

None

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

docs.title: Access.AccessStatement.Language.id
docs.text:
Description:

the language used for the access statement text, identified by a code or other identifier

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: currently limited to ISO 639:2023 (Set 3)

Regex pattern: ^\s*\S.*$

docs.title: Access.AccessStatement.Language.schemaUri
docs.text:
Description:

the URI of the language identifier schema

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

Allowed values (fetched at the time of the documentation generation):

Value Description https://www.iso.org/standard/74575.html https://www.iso.org/standard/74575.html

This is a dynamic enumeration whose values are defined in externally managed vocabulary.

https://vocabulary.raid.org/description.language.schemaUri/240

docs.title: Access.AccessStatement.text
docs.text:
Description:

the text of an access statement that explains any restrictions on access

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

notes: mandatory if access.type.id is not ‘open’

constraints: maximum 1,000 characters

docs.title: Access.embargoExpiry
docs.text:
Description:

the date any embargo on access to the RAiD metadata ends

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

notes: Mandatory if access.type is ‘embargoed’. Embargo expiration dates may not lay more than 18 months from the date the RAiD was registered; year, month, and day must be specified.

docs.title: AlternateIdentifier
docs.text:
Description:

a metadata schema block containing alternative local or global identifiers for the project or activity associated with the RAiD

Requirement: optional

Cardinality:

docs.title: AlternateIdentifier.id
docs.text:
Description:

an identifier other than the RAiD applied to the project or activity

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: An alternateIdentifer.id may be any alphanumeric string that is unique within its domain of issue, for example a local identifier unique to an organisation. The alternateIdentifier.id represents an additional identifier for the same instance of the project or activity; its referent is identical to that of the RAiD.

Regex pattern: ^\s*\S.*$

docs.title: AlternateIdentifier.type
docs.text:
Description:

free text description of the type of alternateIdentifier supplied

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

docs.title: AlternateUrl
docs.text:
Description:

a metadata schema block containing alternative URLs for the project

Requirement: optional

Cardinality:

docs.title: AlternateUrl.url
docs.text:
Description:

a link to another website related to the project or activity

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: An alternateURL can be used to point to any other project website, whether stand-alone, organisational, or in a platform such as Open Science Framework.

Regex pattern: ^\s*\S.*$

docs.title: Contributor
docs.text:
Description:

a metadata schema block containing a contributor to a RAiD and their associated properties

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1..*

docs.title: Contributor.id
docs.text:
Description:

the contributor (person) associated with a project or activity identified by a persistent identifier (PID)

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

notes: Allowed values are identifiers defined by contributor.schemaUri

docs.title: Contributor.status
docs.text:
Description:

None

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

readonly: True

docs.title: Contributor.statusMessage
docs.text:
Description:

None

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

readonly: True

docs.title: Contributor.uuid
docs.text:
Description:

None

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

readonly: True

docs.title: Contributor.schemaUri
docs.text:
Description:

the URI of the contributor identifier schema

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: The controlled list of allowed identifier schemas is defined at https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.schemaUri/215 and is shared across all Registration Agencies.

Allowed values (fetched at the time of the documentation generation):

Value Description https://isni.org/ https://isni.org/ https://orcid.org/ https://orcid.org/

This is a dynamic enumeration whose values are defined in externally managed vocabulary.

Link to the vocabulary:

https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.schemaUri/215

docs.title: Contributor.ContributorPosition
docs.text:
Description:

a metadata schema sub-block describing a contributor’s administrative position on a project or activity

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1..*

constraints: contributors must have one and only one position at any given time (contributors may also be flagged as a ‘leader’ or ‘contact’ separately).

notes: This property represents a contributor’s administrative position on a project (such as their position on a grant application); use contributor.role to define for scientific or scholarly contribution.

docs.title: Contributor.ContributorPosition.startDate
docs.text:
Description:

date the contributor began position associated with the project or activity

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: ISO 8601 standard date, Only the year is required; month and day are optional (but recommended when available).

docs.title: Contributor.ContributorPosition.endDate
docs.text:
Description:

date the contributor terminated position associated with the project or activity

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

notes: ISO 8601 standard date. Only the year is required; month and day are optional (but recommended when available). Recommended if an organisation has changed roles or terminated its relationship with a project

docs.title: Contributor.ContributorPosition.id
docs.text:
Description:

a contributor’s administrative position in the project

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: contributor.position.id for first-entered contributor (only) defaults to ‘Principal or Chief Investigator’

Allowed values (fetched at the time of the documentation generation):

Value Description https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/307 Principal or Chief Investigator https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/308 Co-investigator or Collaborator https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/309 Partner Investigator https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/310 Consultant https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/311 Other Participant

This is a dynamic enumeration whose values are defined in externally managed vocabulary.

Link to the vocabulary:

https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schemaUri/306

docs.title: Contributor.ContributorPosition.schemaUri
docs.text:
Description:

the URI of the position schema used

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: Controlled list informed by Simon Cox’s Project Ontology, OpenAIRE ‘Project’ guidelines, NIH definitions, ARC definitions, and DataCite Metadata Schema 4.4 Appendix 1 Table 5 ‘Description of contributorType’.

Allowed values (fetched at the time of the documentation generation):

Value Description https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/305 https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/305

https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schemaUri/277

This is a dynamic enumeration whose values are defined in externally managed vocabulary.

Link to the vocabulary:

docs.title: RaidDto.Id.Owner.servicePoint
docs.text:
Description:

the Service Point (SP) that requested the RAiD. SPs belong to an owner, RAiD owners can have multiple SPs; SPs do not need to be legal entities

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: A RAiD minted by a Registration Agency must have a SP associated with an Owner affiliated with that Agency; Registration Agencies must maintain and register lists of their Service Points with the RAiD Registration Authority.

docs.title: RaidDto.Id.raidAgencyUrl
docs.text:
Description:

The URL for the raid via the minting raid agency system

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

docs.title: RaidDto.Id.license
docs.text:
Description:

The license under which the RAiD Metadata Record associated with this Identifier has been issued.

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: All RAiD metadata is available on a ‘no rights reserved’ basis unless prohibited by law.

constrains: CC-0 only (with fallback to CC-BY-4.0 in jurisdictions where CC-0 is not allowed)

docs.title: RaidDto.Id.version
docs.text:
Description:

The version of the resource. Read-only. Increments automatically on update.

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: The RAiD version number is set automatically by the RAiD Service software when a RAiD is updated.

ContributorPosition

docs.title: RaidPatchRequest.Contributor.ContributorPosition
docs.text:
Description:

a metadata schema sub-block describing a contributor’s administrative position on a project or activity

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1..*

constraints: contributors must have one and only one position at any given time (contributors may also be flagged as a ‘leader’ or ‘contact’ separately).

notes: This property represents a contributor’s administrative position on a project (such as their position on a grant application); use contributor.role to define for scientific or scholarly contribution.

docs.title: RaidPatchRequest.Contributor.ContributorPosition.startDate
docs.text:
Description:

date the contributor began position associated with the project or activity

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: ISO 8601 standard date, Only the year is required; month and day are optional (but recommended when available).

docs.title: RaidPatchRequest.Contributor.ContributorPosition.endDate
docs.text:
Description:

date the contributor terminated position associated with the project or activity

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

notes: ISO 8601 standard date. Only the year is required; month and day are optional (but recommended when available). Recommended if an organisation has changed roles or terminated its relationship with a project

docs.title: RaidPatchRequest.Contributor.ContributorPosition.id
docs.text:
Description:

a contributor’s administrative position in the project

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: contributor.position.id for first-entered contributor (only) defaults to ‘Principal or Chief Investigator’

Allowed values (fetched at the time of the documentation generation):

Value Description https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/307 Principal or Chief Investigator https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/308 Co-investigator or Collaborator https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/309 Partner Investigator https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/310 Consultant https://vocabulary.raid.org/contributor.position.schema/311 Other Participant

docs.title: .embargoExpiry
docs.text:
Description:

the date any embargo on access to the RAiD metadata ends

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

notes: Mandatory if access.type is ‘embargoed’. Embargo expiration dates may not lay more than 18 months from the date the RAiD was registered; year, month, and day must be specified.

docs.title: .endDate
docs.text:
Description:

None

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

notes: ISO 8601 standard date. Only the year is required; month and day are optional (but recommended when available). Recommended if an organisation has changed roles or terminated its relationship with a project

Requirement: optional

Cardinality: 0..1

docs.title: .license
docs.text:
Description:

The license under which the RAiD Metadata Record associated with this Identifier has been issued.

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: All RAiD metadata is available on a ‘no rights reserved’ basis unless prohibited by law.

constrains: CC-0 only (with fallback to CC-BY-4.0 in jurisdictions where CC-0 is not allowed)

docs.title: .servicePoint
docs.text:
Description:

the Service Point (SP) that requested the RAiD. SPs belong to an owner, RAiD owners can have multiple SPs; SPs do not need to be legal entities

Requirement: mandatory

Cardinality: 1

notes: A RAiD minted by a Registration Agency must have a SP associated with an Owner affiliated with that Agency; Registration Agencies must maintain and register lists of their Service Points with the RAiD Registration Authority.
